column4: hey everyone, i have been following the following instructions to fix my boot loader: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows but when i try to set the root it tells me the Selected Disk does not exist
anyone know whats wrong? im doing root (hd0,0) and my / is mounted on hda1
on a dual boot windows is usually hda1
on my box, i have hda2 set as my ntfs partition. hda1 is ext3
I thought windows would insist on installing on the first partition on the first drive usually. but ok
i dont know, i dont think so
the grub shell should let you tab complete though
it has tab completion for the commands but if i do root (hd and press tab it wont work
then I think it doesn't recognize it. it should let you usually I think
hmm alright ill try some other things i guess
are you doing it from the live cd or what?
yes from live cd, but im going to try and do it through the rescue console in the main menu of the live cd
is the live cd able to mount your linux partition?
